result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary C Pitej was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation with no positive UA's

miscConds.notes: DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week for the first six months of probation and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: Expungement to be granted upon successful completion of probation with no positive UA's or new arrests.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol or controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week for the first six months of probation and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes: RCJ for contempt for failure to pay by due date.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zachary C Pitej

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per RCSO, DNA collected - 01-25-2016 at 11:00 am
Letters in regards to Plea & Sentencing from ATTY NOONAN
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Zachary C Pitej in court with attorney Kevin T. Noonan.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachary C Pitej
Current: 7565 Galena St, Crystal Lake, IL 60014 United States  (Effective: 09-12-2015)
Prior: 32915 Center St, Burlington, WI 53105
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Defendant Zachary C Pitej in court.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defendant has obtained counsel and requests adjournment. 
BTC: Adjournment granted.   Finding of good cause to waive time limits.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  No contact with the victims, AC and WP (person, property, residence or family).   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Zachary C Pitej in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Zachary C Pitej in custody.  Robin K. Green appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 09:00 am.
